item.value: Saxon.NET Beta VI to be posted soon...
item.p: Mon, 1 Nov 2004 12:35:46 GMT :: by M. David Peterson

I've got a new build done and the beginning of an encapsulation library that will reduce the required namespace imports to one and will allow any XmlDocument, XPathDocument, File, or Stream .NET types as input sources and return a string that can be loaded into any of these same types for further processing (Saxon.NET XSLT or XQuery or System.Xml.Xsl), saving to file, pushed out onto a stream, or serialized as a SOAP message for delivery to a remote client for processing. Hope to get at least the new build and the start of that library posted today sometime. Subscribe to the RSS or ATOM feeds for notification of its availability.
Cheers!

item.value: First look at xameleon project GUI...
item.p: Sun, 01 Aug 2004 02:06:45 GMT :: by M. David Peterson

xameleon stands for "eXtensible Adaptation Markup Extension Library Engine w/ Open iNtegration". The general idea is to create a plug-in style IDE that uses an extensible library of XML elements that make the process of adapting and transforming data (and generate any associated Java, C#, ASP.NET, etc... code that goes along with it) as simple as adding files to a project, telling the engine what type of output you are looking for, set any further particulars, and then click go and let the engine to the rest of the work for you. More on what xameleon is or will be coming soon but in the mean time check out the screen shots of the current GUI design. This is liable to change at any given time but this should help give you a clearer picture on just what the xameleon project is all about.
Image one can be seen here.
Image two can be seen here.
More to come in the near future.
